page.title: 14Farming in the District
page.content: The land cover for our block is almost exclusively{intensively managed {grassland}used for pasture or for cutting as{hay}or{silage;}most of it good{Grade 3}land with areas of{Grade {2.}Little wonder then that{Farming is {extremely}important in this district. There are nearly{30}farms ranging from 3 tiny{10-12 acre}small holdings to one over{200 acres}the average size being between{70-100,}mainly dealing with{dairy/beef cattle, sheep, hay, {silage}and a little{cereal crop.} Larger, more economical, holdings have replaced many small holdings and some have moved from mixed farming to greater{specialisation in dairy farming. A cause for concern for these farmers is the{EEC's Milk Quota System implemented in{1984}to cut the milk yield by{9%}as this has put the brakes on expansion in this line of work.
